Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effects of Hydroxyethyl Starches on Kidney Function

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was individual patients, with a sample size of 11,399 across 42 studies.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients requiring fluid resuscitation.

Intervention.evidence: comparing HES to other fluid therapies.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was renal replacement therapy (RRT) and acute kidney injury (AKI) over a follow-up period defined by the RIFLE criteria.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 11,399 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: with 9,857 analysed for RRT and 8,402 for AKI.

Result_Outcome.evidence: HES increased the risk of RRT (RR 1.31, 95% CI 1.16 to 1.49) and AKI (RR 1.14, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.30).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding sources were not reported.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding sources were not reported.
